basics.name: Pablo Soler
basics.label: Electrical & Software Engineer
basics.summary: I'm a Master student at ETH Zürich with a strong passion for robotics and machine learning. I did my undergraduate in RWTH Aachen in Germany and then moved to Zürich to pursue a Master's degree in electrical engineering and information technology.

work.name: Little Scientists Schweiz
work.summary:
Teach kids aged from 8-12 years old to build and program LEGO robotics, creating projects ranging from self-driving cars to Endless Runner games.
Organized challenges and workshops to foster creativity and interest in STEM, including engaging science demonstrations for schools and companies.

work.name: Ford Research and Innovation Center Aachen
work.summary:
1. Research and deploy an operator detection and tracking pipeline
- Implement a YOLO-based object detection and pose estimation model
- Implement a person classification model based on residual neural networks
- Study the use of transformers for depth perception

2. Study vision algorithms for road conditions monitoring
- Training and testing different neural network models using data augmentation techniques and model quantization

Patent pending for the operator detection project

Frameworks used throughout the project: Python, Pytorch, opencv, onnx, huggingface, C++, libtorch

work.name: Institute for Power Electronics and Electric Drives, RWTH Aachen
work.summary:
Study and design multiple machine learning based algorithms for real-time fault detection in the electrical drives of robo-taxis.

The project involved using finite element analysis simulations, wavelet transformation and convolutional neural networks.

I started on this research topic as part of my bachelor thesis at RWTH Aachen, and I continued it as a research assistant at the institute.

Frameworks used throughout the project: PLECS, MATLAB, Simulink, JMAG, Python, Pytorch
highlights: This work resulted in the publication of a paper titled: Fault Detection and Classification of Inter-Turn Short Circuit Faults for Electrical Machines with Convolutional Neural Networks” presented at IEMDC23 by the IEEE Industrial Electronics Society.

work.name: Institute for Automation of Complex Systems, RWTH Aachen
work.summary:
Supervisor at a computer science lab for electrical and computer engineering students.

Tasks: Teaching, helping, and testing students.

Throughout the semester the students implemented a C++ project simulating a network of cars driving in a virtual environment.

publications.name: HoloSpot: Intuitive Object Manipulation via Mixed Reality Drag-and-Dropr
publications.summary: A Hololens2 interface projecting a 3D representation of a scanned room as a scaled-down hologram, allowing users to manipulate objects using a drag-and-drop interface. The Spot robot then executes the requested action.

publications.name: Classification of Inter-Turn Short Circuit Faults in Field-Oriented Controlled Electrical Machines using Convolutional Neural Networks
publications.publisher: 2023 IEEE International Electric Machines & Drives Conference (IEMDC)
publications.summary: The publication presents a workflow to model a Permanent Magnet Synchronous Machine (PMSM) with different fault severity levels and proposes a novel CNN-based approach for detection and severity estimation of Inter-turn Short Circuit (ITSC) faults that is highly accurate.
